body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install go-bootstrap
...
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/usr/bin/bash' 'make.bash'
See build log for details:
  /tmp/spack-stage-myname/go-bootstrap-1.4-bootstrap-20171003-fwelxwvs7k4snqjsbeez6ujmybyazry3/spack-build-out.txt

$ cat /tmp/spack-stage-myname/go-bootstrap-1.4-bootstrap-20171003-fwelxwvs7k4snqjsbeez6ujmybyazry3/spack-build-out.txt
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> [2019-08-21-11:36:41.135046] '/usr/bin/bash' 'make.bash'
# Building C bootstrap tool.
cmd/dist
go tool dist: unknown architecture: ppc64le
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux hostname 4.14.0-115.10.1.el7a.ppc64le #1 SMP Wed Jun 26 09:32:17 UTC 2019 ppc64le ppc64le ppc64le GNU/Linux
$ cat /etc/os-release 
NAME="Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server"
VERSION="7.6 (Maipo)"
...
``` 

I know there are Debian packages for golang...
title: go-bootstrap: arch ppc64le unknown?
